Deficiency Narrative: A child suffered an injury on 5/21/2025 while playing basketball, however, the child was not taken to seek medical attention until 5/29/2025. When the child was seen by medical, he was diagnosed with a closed fracture.
Correction Narrative: On 7/24/2025, the operation's Administrator provided the following correction via email: The standard states that a child in care must receive medical care as needed for injury, illness and pain.  I would like to note that the child did receive medical care for the injury as noted by the documentation that you have already received.  I did not see in the standard listed any specific time frame for a response time.

Deficiency Narrative: Licensing was not notified within 24 hours of a child's diagnosed fracture. The diagnosis was provided on 5/29/2025 at approximately 530pm, however, the report to SWI did not occur until 5/30/2025 at approximately 630pm.
Correction Narrative: On 7/24/2025, the operation's Administrator provided the following correction via email: I will remind all on-call persons that we have to file the occurrence no later than 24 hours.  The person who was on-call for this incident will be written up for the infraction, because it is known that we have a 24-hour window.  I will go back over this standard with everyone that is on-call.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection I observed three resident beds that lacked mattress covers.
During the inspection, we observed five of six employee files lacking the requisite administrating psychotropic medications training.
Correction Narrative: On 5/8/25, the operation submitted a plan indicating all residential staff, both residential directors, and the medication director will be retrained in administering medications on 5/13/25.  The name and credentials of the individual conducting the instructor led training were submitted and satisfactory.  The plan notes the operation will update their training protocols for new hires to ensure a medical professional leads the training for all new hires as well.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed missing trim with exposed nails inside a cabin bathroom and damaged drywall around the entry to a bedroom in another cabin with exposed corner protectors and around the window.
Correction Narrative: A follow-up inspection was completed to verify deficiencies observed on 2/21/2025, were corrected. No additional concerns observed on this date.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed mildew in the wooden shower and bathroom walls and celings of four cottages. A shower in one of the houses exhibited low water pressure.
Correction Narrative: A follow-up inspection was completed to verify deficiencies observed on 2/21/2025, were corrected. No additional concerns observed on this date.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, the dishwasher in New Lodge was observed to be dirty and a bathroom wall had mold/mildew.
Correction Narrative: On 1/29/2025, the operation's Assistant Director provided photographs to reflect a new dishwasher was installed to replace the old dishwasher, and mold/mildew on bathroom wall has been corrected.

Deficiency Narrative:
During the investigation inspection, it was discovered that
New Lodge had a used fire extinguisher. According to staff and documentation the fire extinguisher was used eight days prior, and a request was submitted for a new one; however, the extinguisher for this Lodge has not been replaced yet.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, I observed two fire extinguishers in the lodge that were fully charged and were in date.  The discharged or undercharged extinguishers had been removed from the building.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were able to secure tools from restricted areas at the operation- which enabled them to dismantle the window in their cottage and engage in illegal activities.
Correction Narrative: An email was received on 12/18/24 from Blake Nelson. They are retraining staff on supervision and stressing the importance of appropriate language in front of and in the vicinity of the residents. An inspection will be completed, as this is a high-weighted citation.   A follow-up inspection was completed on 12/19/24 showing compliance by the staff areas being locked, ratio intact, and no MSV.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed the following physical site issues to be in compliant:  A shower head in one of the resident bathrooms was broken and needed replacing, a small closet/storage area door in one of the cottages was broken with exposed nails, the cabinet in the laundry room of one cottage has been broken with a maintenance report on file since 7/27/24, a toilet in one cottage lacked a tank lid with a maintenance report filed 9/2/24. I observed the following to still be deficient and an extension is being granted: shower surround in one bathroom evidenced a peeling backing board above the shower surround,and  a broken bathroom door. I observed a new deficiency during my walk through. There wa drywall damage in Vickie's Main half bath.
Correction Narrative: During the walkthrough, I verified the physical site deficiencies yet unfinished in the previous follow-up have been completed.  This standard is now in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed two freezers in one of the houses has replaced the missing thermometers.
Correction Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed two freezers in one of the houses has replaced the missing thermometers.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, we observed uncovered food in the refrigerator of one of the cottages.
Correction Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed no uncovered food in the refrigerator of the cottage.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, we observed two bathrooms lacking handtowels in the restrooms.
Correction Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed two bathrooms that was lacking hand towels in the restrooms to now have hand towels for each resident or a roll of paper towels.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, we observed the following physical site issues:  A shower head in one of the resident bathrooms was broken and needed replacing, shower surround in one bathroom evidenced a peeling backing board above the shower surround, a small closet/storage area door in one of the cottages was broken with exposed nails, the cabinet in the laundry room of one cottage has been broken with a maintenance report on file since 7/27/24, a toilet in one cottage lacked a tank lid with a maintenance report filed 9/2/24.  Items with maintenance reports on file are not being completed in a timely manner.
During the inspection, we observed a bathroom in one of the lodges lacking any toilet paper.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a toilet paper in the bathroom in one of the lodges that was lacking toilet paper.

Deficiency Narrative: This deficiency was noted as part of a DFPS investigation.
Correction Narrative: On 8/2/24, the operation submitted corrections stating the staff in question was not permitted sole supervision of residents through the investigation.  She and all other staff were retrained in safe handling, storage, and usage of harmful chemicals and the expectations of supervision for residents on restriction status as reflected in their policies.  The staff was written up.  These topics will continue to be covered with the Residential Directors and House Directors during group meetings and one-on-one meetings so they may continue to review them with staff.   The staff member specified in the incident was terminated on 8/2/24.

Deficiency Narrative: During the DFPS investigation, it was discovered the operation failed to properly supervise children in care, resulting in the children being able to "cheek" medications as well as crushing and snorting medications brought home from the hospital.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted a correction plan on 8/2/24 stating they have conducted a retraining with all staff regarding how to do medication checks after a child has taken their meds.  The house in question has also added the additional step of utilizing a flashlight to look in the children's mouths.  The staff involved in the incident were written up, and one of those staff has been terminated.  The operation will continue to train and review the importance of being aware with all residential staff and remind them to keep their senses heightened when children have been off property.

Deficiency Narrative: During the DFPS investigation, it was discovered the operation failed to secure poisonous cleaning supplies, allowing children unsupervised access.
Correction Narrative:
On 8/14/24, an unannounced follow-up inspection confirmed chemicals were properly stored.  No concerns were noted regarding hazardous materials.  This brings this standard into compliance.

On 8/2/24, the operation provided a correction plan stating the administration retrained all staff on the importance of supervision for residents using harmful chemicals with all staff as well as supervision expectations for residents on restriction status utilizing harmful chemicals.  The operation terminated the employment of the staff responsible for the incident.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, there was mold/mildew observed in the bathroom of the East House and Old Lodge. There was also sheet rock damage observed a bathroom located in the East House.
Correction Narrative: The Executive Director/Administrator provided an email with the operation's plan for correcting the deficiency. He advised they will reiterate with residential staff, House Directors and Residential Directors that all damage and any mildew needs to be communicated through a maintenance request to the appropriate maintenance staff.  I will remind maintenance staff that all orders need to be handled in a timely manner.  We will also remind the Residential Directors to be looking for these things as they check houses and report anything to maintenance staff as well. Photos were provided to confirm corrections were made to mold and sheet rock.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, there was potatoes stored on the pantry floor of New Lodge and Vickie's House.
Correction Narrative: The Executive Director/Administrator provided an email with the operation's plan for correcting the deficiency. He advised they have already and will continue to remind the residential staff that food cannot be stored on the floor.  They will continue to monitor through routine inspections.  The maintenance staff have been asked to add shelving to the floor to eliminate this issue. Photos were provided to confirm corrections were made and food is no longer stored on the floor of the pantry.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, it was observed the four showers located in the East House only had lukewarm/room temperature water for the children to shower.
Correction Narrative: During the investigation inspection, it was observed the four showers located in the East House only had lukewarm/room temperature water for the children to shower. During the follow up inspection, the deficiency was observed to have been corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, the thermometer located in the East House freezer indicated the freezer was at 16 degrees Fahrenheit, and not at the required 0 degree Fahrenheit or below.  Additionally, the thermometer located in Vickie's House refrigerator indicated the refrigerator was at 45 degrees Fahrenheit, and not at the required 40 degree Fahrenheit or below.
Correction Narrative: The Executive Director/Administrator provided an email with the operation's plan for correcting the deficiency. He advised they will issue a reminder to all house staff and Residential staff to look at the temperature of the refrigerators and freezers as they are pulling out food to prepare and report any changes from the 40 degrees for the refrigerator and 0 degrees for the freezer so that appropriate actions can be taken.  They replaced the refrigerator at Vickis to help solve this issue. Photos were provided to confirm corrections were made address thermometers were at the required temperatures.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, there was a first aid kit stored, unlocked and accessible to children, in the bathroom of the East House. The first aid kid contained topical creams and cold compress both of which were labeled to keep out of reach of children.

This concern arose during the course of the DFPS investigation, based on a review of the evidence obtained, a staff member failed to secure a box of over-the-counter medication stored in the staff office, resulting in a resident accessing and ingesting the medication without supervision.
Correction Narrative: A walk though of the staff office in the East House was completed on this day. There were no medications observed. The staff who had the OTC mediation is no longer employeed with the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: This concern arose during the course of the DFPS investigation, based on a review of the evidence obtained, a safety plan established on 5/16/24 indicated a specific staff member would not administer restraints until the close of the ongoing investigation, but documentation indicates the staff member engaged in a restraint on 6/11/24.
Correction Narrative: The operation  provided proof of writing-up the staff that completed a restraint while prohibited by safety plan, and indicated the operation would review restraint expectations with him and all staff members.  The responsible staff was noted as being prohibited from utilizing EBI except in emergency situations wherein a child's life may be in danger.

Deficiency Narrative: This concern arose during the course of the DFPS investigation, based on a review of the evidence obtained, a staff member restrained a child about the head or throat area during a restraint.
Correction Narrative: The operation indicated they would meet with the responsible staff and provided proof of write-up for said staff.  He will not be allowed to intervene with EBI in any circumstances other than a clear emergency. Administration will review restraint expectations with all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: This concern arose during the course of the DFPS investigation, based on a review of the evidence obtained, a staff member utilized restraint as a means to gain compliance from a child that refused to leave a peer's room.
Correction Narrative: The operation indicated they would meet with the responsible staff, and he will be written-up.  He will not be allowed to intervene with EBI in any circumstances other than a clear emergency.  The operation will review the appropriate reasons to utilize restraints with all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: During the ANE investigation, it was discovered that five of six residents interviewed reported staff cursing and yelling at them.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a written plan to write-up the staff in question and will review expectations for appropriate communications.  The operation also offers small groups for the staff to attend that provide counseling options for staff members.  The administration will also offer additional training.  The staff self-terminated employment following the meeting.

Deficiency Narrative: This concern arose during the course of the DFPS investigation, based on a review of the evidence obtained, staff initiated restraints for in non-emergency situations.
Correction Narrative: The operation indicated they would meet with the responsible staff, and he will be written-up.  He will not be allowed to intervene with EBI in any circumstances other than a clear emergency.  The operation will review the requirement of an emergency situation when initiating EBI with all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed one child's initial medical exam was completed 24 days past the 30 days from admission date.
Correction Narrative: On 3/27/24, the operation provided an email accounting of their shift in protocol, unify medical appointments under a single person to ensure important deadlines were not missed.  He noted this referenced file predated that protocol shift and this new procedure will prevent recurrence of this issue in the future.  A copy of this email can be found in Document Library.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a drainage issue in the sink of one cottage, a toilet holding human waste that did not cycle when tested in another cabin, and a cracked shower stall in a third cabin.  None of these repairs had work orders filed on them at the time of the inspection.
Correction Narrative: On 3/27/24, the operation provided pictures and a narrative detailing the repairs completed on the sink, toilet, and shower, bringing this standard into compliance.    A copy of this email and pictures can be found in Document Library.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed three refrigerator thermometers reading in excess of the permitted 40 degrees, and one deep freeze unit lacked a thermometer.
Correction Narrative: On 3/25/24, the operation emailed photo proof of the refrigeration units being replaced or new thermometers installed and showing temperatures in range.    A copy of these pictures can be found in Document Library.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed an open water valve recess outside a cottage lacking a protective cover, creating a tripping hazard.  The operation replaced this cover at the time of the inspection.
During the walkthrough, I observed excessive dust and cobwebs and cracked paint near the ceiling in one of the bedrooms.
Correction Narrative: On 3/27/24, the operation provided an email and photographic evidence of the correction to the dust and cobweb issue noted in the citation.  A copy of this email and pictures can be found in Document Library.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, one child's medication record was reviewed and observed to be missing the full name of the person who administered the medication.
Correction Narrative: On 9/26/23, the operation emailed proof of medication documentation re-training for the staff responsible for medication administration.  This should mitigate the risk of recidivism and brings the standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed that one of the fire extinguishers in a resident cabin lacked a tag or documentation denoting when it was last serviced.  The operation replaced the fire extinguisher during the walkthrough with one that was properly tagged.
During the inspection, I observed two beds without protective mattress covers.  The operation replaced the mattress covers during the inspection.

During the monitoring inspection, it was observed that two children's medication record and actual medication count did not match. The medication record reflected there were 4 doses remaining while the package only contained 2 doses and another child's medication record indicated 3 doses remaining but the package contained 4 doses.
Correction Narrative: During follow up inspection, all 6 medication records reviewed showed accurate counts with no issues in documentation.  This standard is now in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a cottage cabinet with a hole broken through it that staff reported being there over two weeks.  The lights in the laundry room of one cabin were burned out and were replaced by the operation during the walkthrough.
Correction Narrative: on 9/26/23, the operation emailed proof of the repaired cabinet in the form of pictures documenting the repair.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that one of the maintenance staff hired on 5/1/23 does not have an initial background upon hire with the facility.
Correction Narrative: Following the inspection, the operation administrator provided me with email confirmation that he entered the staff's background check, and I verified in the system that the check has been entered.  Administrator noted that the staff would not be returning to the operation until background check results were received.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a mini fridge in one of the cabins that exhibited a thermometer reading of 50 degrees Fahrenheit.  The operation turned down the temperature in the unit during the inspection to correct the temperature.
In reviewing the documentation and investigation interviews, I observed that the operation failed to report the serious accidental injury of a resident within 24 hours.
Correction Narrative: On 8/14/23, the operation provided a written plan of correction indicating that operation staff would be retrained on reporting procedures and time frames.  It states that all incidents are to be reported to the Residential Director on-call, and then reported to one of two Directors of Residential Living and one of them will report to the Executive Director.  The administrator clarifies in the text that he will inform his staff that the reporting timeframe begins at the time of the incident.  He also indicated that this training would occur on 8/14/23, and the individual that failed to report the incident in a timely manner will be reprimanded with a possible financial penalty depending on the outcome of the Administrative Penalty.  A copy of this plan is stored in RCCR digital storage for this investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, there was a jug of mop solution located under the kitchen sink, unlocked, in the New Lodge Home.
During the inspection, I observed four mattresses on the floor of loft areas in the cabins.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the cabin mattresses have been fitted with risers that raise the beds off the floor of the loft sleeping areas.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed a light switch in one cottage with a missing face plate, and a cabinet door in another cottage had a faulty hinge.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the light switch and cabinets were repaired and in good condition.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed two refrigerators without requisite thermometers.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, I observed that the refrigerator thermometers had been replaced and were functioning properly.

Deficiency Narrative: In one of six employee records reviewed, the caregiver employee did not receive 16 hours of EBI preservice training.  Only two hours were documented for the employee in the file.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided documentation showing the missing EBI training for the caregiver's file.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough, I observed holes in the drywall in the bedroom of one lodge and the downstairs bathroom of the second lodge.
Correction Narrative: I observed the locations in where the holes were previously located in the cottages.  The operation has patched the holes and the walls are now in good repair.

Deficiency Narrative: In one of the six employee files read, the record did not reflect the employee receiving annual Normalcy training in the past two years.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided an email detailing measures to ensure each staff member receives Normalcy training annually by providing regularly scheduled opportunities twice a year and requiring all applicable staff to participate.

Deficiency Narrative: The purpose of this rule is to protect the health, safety and well being of children in care by ensuring that caregivers are provided and are informed of all the child's needs, medical conditions and any other information of the children they are supervising.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from the agency.
Correction:  The agency we will continue to have the allergies listed on the outside of the childs notebook, written on the initial assessment, verbally communicated to the intake house staff, and a memo will be put in all staffs mailboxes today directing them to communicate to any staff coming into the intake about the childs allergy and communicating to the staff of another house that the resident may visit about the allergy as well.  The memo will be distributed July 14th, 2022.

Deficiency Narrative: A Staff Member was provoking / antagonizing the child in care by raising her voice and saying things such as oh your pissed off, theres the door and your mad at me so why dont you hit me.
Correction Narrative: We will address with our staff in our Monday morning training meetings what is the appropriate way to interact with kids and how to engage with them in a manner that is not provoking.  We will do this over the next two weeks to ensure that we cover all residential staff members.  We also just completed a staff training week last week where we covered a lot of these types of topics as well

Deficiency Narrative: (2) out of (6) records reviewed were missing a dental examination. One record indicated that an appointment was rescheduled, however, there was not an appointment scheduled.
Correction Narrative: The operation will maintain all dental care as noted by treating doctors. The child that was missing the appointment has a future appointment scheduled.

Deficiency Narrative: In 4 of 4 records reviewed there was not a documented notice given for the child service planning meeting.
Correction Narrative: An email template was provided of the email that will be sent out to parents at least two weeks prior to the service plan being due. The Director of Counseling has set up a schedule on the computer indicating when service plans are due and  reminders to send to families. The Director of Counseling is the sole person in charge of ensuring this happens, so that it only passes through one individual.

Deficiency Narrative: (1) of the (2) homes inspected had emergency evacuation and relocation diagrams that did not include designated location outside of the building. Also, the designated meeting place for weather disaster was not included. This is a separate standard, but all designated meeting areas for emergency evacuation should be included on the diagram.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent with attached diagrams reflecting emergency evacuation routes for all houses with meeting places noted on the diagram.

Deficiency Narrative: A child drank hand sanitizer and had to be taken to the Emergency Room.  Staff failed to report this incident to the hotline.
Correction Narrative: Brooke Lane of Heartlight sent an email stating that they would be upholding standard 748.309, and that they would be reporting all serious incidents according to the standard.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the eight emergency behavior intervention records reviewed showed that caregivers failed to re-explain every 15 minutes what the child needed to do in order to be released from the intervention.
Correction Narrative: New training was done to  re-teach staff how to do restraints, and how to report any restraints.  See digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: Six out of the eight emergency behavior interventions records reviewed showed no time of the incident.
Correction Narrative: New training was done to  re-teach staff how to do restraints, and how to report any restraints.  See digital storage.

Deficiency Narrative: Two cabins were inspected and one bed was missing a mattress protector; and another bed was missing a pillowcase.
Correction Narrative: Pictures were sent of the mattress protectors and bedding on the beds that.

Deficiency Narrative: There were two unreported suicide attempts on 3/7 and 3/8/2021.
Correction Narrative: New training was done to  re-teach staff What needs to be reported - and what the time frames are.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report a child in care was taken to the hospital for an allergic reaction to a known nut allergy, that warrant treatment by a medical professional.
Correction Narrative: The operation scheduled a meeting with all regional directors, who are on-call and typically the ones that are making the reports to the hotline number when these types of situation arise, to discuss not only filing in the appropriate time frame, but also communicating in the operation chain of command  effectively so that this type of thing doesnt get missed again.

Deficiency Narrative: Window blinds, floor tiles, cabinet pulls, outlet covers, two  commode flushing concerns, loose commode lid and broken flat screen TV were noted during the walkthrough.
Correction Narrative:
2/1/2021 Some documentation was submited (photo) of the most pressing safety concern - - broken Flat Screen with glass shards exposed.  Photo was submitted showing the TV has been removed to the dumpster.   Other corrections are underway and will be submitted tomorrow.   Some items required a plumber and a work order will be submitted.   

2/10/2021 a final invoice was provided to day confirming that the leak over the sink has been fixed.   

All photos and involce are stored in the share drive digital storage under Reg. 04/Heartlight/After Hours . . . folder for 2021.
